CSS-webkit-line-clamp.summary: The -webkit-line-clamp CSS property allows limiting of the contents of a block to the specified number of lines.

remarks.para: It only works in combination with the display property set to -webkit-box or -webkit-inline-box and the box-orient property set to vertical.
In most cases you will also want to set overflow to hidden, otherwise the contents won't be clipped but an ellipsis will still be shown after the specified number of lines.
When applied to anchor elements, the truncating can happen in the middle of the text, not necessarily at the end.

blockquote.para: Note: This property was originally implemented in WebKit and has some issues. It got standardized in CSS Overflow Module Level 4 for legacy support. The CSS Overflow Module Level 4 specification also defines a line-clamp property, which is meant to replace this property and avoid its issues.
